text: Draft from Whole Foods. Interesting brew for sure. It seemed like a British IPA to me but it its called an imperial pilsner/lager here. Sweet and grassy, medium weight, notes of lemon verbena, chamomile, capsicum, maybe saaz and fuggles. Clean on the palate with a mild after taste. A good one.
The Sampler, Brooklyn tap: pours deep golden with a white head. Aroma is citrus, tropical fruity. Taste is mostly fruity. Not very sweet or very bitter. Easy to drink. Pretty dank.

16 ounce can. Hazy deep gold color. Large frothy white head. Nice clinging lace. Big dank hop aroma with citrus notes. Flavor upfront is intense complex hops. Resiny, dank and juicy. All this attention to hops is clearly evident. Notes of mint, lemon verbena, Thai basil, grapefruit and a late grab of toasted malt. Warming alcohol notes. Quite tasty, this one.

16oz can, slight hazy golden hue, with a fluffy white, with a nice tropical, citrusy, leafy, grassy hoppy nose, and some zesty candied lemon peel, lemon marmalade, lemon tea leaf, lemon pie crust accents, and faint candied pilsner, pale, bready malt, crackery note in the aroma follows through on a medium-bodied palate with a zesty, spritzy candied lemon, grapefruit, green grapefruit peel, lemon marmalade, lemon pie crust character with some good flowery citrusy, leafy, piney, grassy, tropical hoppy, subtle lemongrass, lemon tea leaf, subtle lemon candyish lollipop flavours, leading towards a candied lemon rind zestiness, lingering citrusy, leafy, grassy, tropical hop bitterness finish.

Bottle, 355 ml, courtesy of Marko, shared with him and ogivlado. Hazy yellow, white head. Nice hoppy, citrus, grapefruit, grass, cats piss aroma. Nice hoppy bitter finish. Medium bodied. Average carbonation.

On tap at Hops Hill. Smells like a swimming pool. Really weird. Pours a golden amber. Malty, strong alcohol flavor. Good finish. Interesting. Tastes stronger than it is. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Rating No.7500
Canned 440ml. -Courtesy of Marko, shared with him and Iznogud. Orange/golden coloured, small white head, citrusy hoppy nose. Moderate malty, heavy fresh citrusy fruity hoppy and well balanced bitterness. Notes of alcohol as well but well rounded. Dry bitter hoppy finish. Really really good brew.
Best IPL ever! No really, it was that good. And Im a big fan of the Mass Rising, but this was better. All about the hops with mild to moderate bitterness. Will grab even more of this next year.

Enormous thanks MacBoost! Shared with ogivlado and Iznogud! Poured a hazy pale golden body, small white head. Superb, fresh aroma, dank, orange, onions, cat piss, just lovely! Nice, soft light body, just a vague touch of caramel, to support a nice, citric-herbal hoppiness, some onion too, lighter than expected, but superbly drinkable. Actually more complex than expected, getting more interestingly hoppy by the sip. Just great. Alcohol very, VERY well hidden. One of the best hoppy lagers ever, anywhere!
Pours gold with an offwhite head. Aroma is pineapple, earthy, grass and citrus. Medium bodied, alcohol well hidden, good carbonation. Nicely done pils as it is bitter with a touch of sweetness.

Keg at Blue Tusk. Hazy amber, large creamy offwhite head, good retention. Aroma of crackers malt, floral hops, mango. Taste is floral, earthy, mango, papaya hops, pale malt. Medium bodied, well balanced, mild lingering bitterness.

Pour from a can, consistent amber color and not cloudy. Slight head. Taste is sweet with a hop bite. Very smooth and not much aftertaste. I recommend for anyone who finds 2x IPA too aggressive. Nicely done.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

16oz can. This is a great rendition of the "Double India Pale Lager" concept, with an obscene amount of tropical fruit hop character and a very light, basically imperceptible lager yeast flavor. It drinks like a DIPA, which is a high compliment.
Can from Toby. Very pale golden, fine sparse head. Light citrusy aromas, taste ticks up the tartness, tangy: prickly finish. Fairly juicy, light on the palate.
16oz can thanks to toby. Pours out a golden topped with a white head. Nose is tropical fruit notes kiwi and some sweetness. Taste is more of the nice tropical fruits citrus sweetness.
Super big frothy head clear straw Amber color. Big vegetative green slight piny aromas. Nice bitter sappy pine flavors that blends and mellows in to a sweet sap base slight syrup consistency.

50cl bottle. Medium off-white head atop cloudy light amber body, nice lacing. Aroma is moderately sweet, grapefruit, some berry, light bread, alcohol. Taste is moderately sweet, grapefruit, some berry, straw, tangerine, light lemon. Medium body, some resin, acidity.

16oz can. Pours hazy gold with a moderate white head. Aroma is floral hops, grapefruit, mango, pineapple, and grass. Taste is similar with delicate pineapple and grapefruit up front giving way to resiny pine, grain, and a strong malt presence. Strong bitterness. Finishes a little harsh with acrid resin. Medium-full body. Soft carbonation. Silky, thick mouthfeel.

Can from Milk and Hops, Chelsea. Hazy orange pour, frothy beige head and strong lacework. Juicy, fruity aroma. Good amount of dank hops as well. Floral notes. Grains and bready spice. Fairly bitter over a pretty strong malt presence. Fairly full bodied, crisp, with average carbonation and a little bit of boozy heat. Pretty enjoyable.

Thanks Shawn McShowber. Pours a slightly hazy muted orange color with a small white head. Lacing left on the glass. Aroma of grassy, dank floral hops and light grainy malt. Taste is of nice floral, grassy hops, and slightly sweet grainy malt. Drying finish. Not much detection of alcohol. Medium mouthful. Easy drinking. Great rendition of this style. This would be my go-to beer if available.

Draught @ Albion.Clear rich golden with large foamy off-white head, strong piney aroma, high carbonation, medium bitter hoppy taste, thin body, long medium bitter finish. If this is not an IPA I dont know what is.

2015 BJCP Category: 22A Double IPA 
AROMA: Potent hop presence of grassy/spicy/herbal aromatics. Some citrus as well. No distinct malt presence. Clean fermentation profile. 9/12APPEARANCE: Amber/pale orange hue; slightly cloudy body but CO2 visible. Large white froth retains and laces very well. 3/3FLAVOR: Dank hop flavor and bitterness hits the tongue with a thud rather than a crisp sensation. Flavors are of the New England-style IPA sub-genre (grassy/spicy/oniony). Only a minor orange flavor on the backend. No real malt sweetness aside from a slight honey taste, although palette is definitely not off-balanced. Some alcohol emerges right as it finishes. Clean fermentation. 16/20MOUTHFEEL: Medium-full bodied; medium CO2. Mouthfeel is thick, soft, and smooth. Some alcohol warmth from the 8.3% ABV and a brief dry sensation (not astringent per se). 4/5OVERALL IMPRESSION: Another very good NEIPA made even more impressive by the fact its a lager. Glad to see it in cans, too. 8/10TOTAL SCORE: 40/50

Draft at Khyber Pass. Tulip. Hazy blunt gold pour with soft off-white foam and lace. Expected fuzzy Kiwi hops but feels a bit smoother and managed this time. Unobtrusive balancing malts. Notes of satsuma, mango, blood orange, wood resins, and bamboo. Feels solid.
Tall can from Whole Foods, Columbus Circle. Hazy golden body with slight head. Nose is hoppy, floral, straw. Taste is hoppy, straw and nice bite to it. Pretty solid hops to it. Nice stuff.

Pours clear gold with a huge pillowy white head...great retention and lacing. Aroma is slightly boozy and has a good bit of melon...some hoppy spice...touch of fruit. Flavor is even more boozy...firm bitterness...resinous...earthy malts. Mouthfeel is medium/full with a dry, resinous finish.

Clear waffle yellow pour with a ring of white foam The nose - melon, orange juice, tropical melange. On the palette, crisp and sugary, medium bodied
The backbone has a dry coating of flour, which seems odd to me

My first Double IPL...lets see where the bar is set.

Poured from a large can. Golden colour- on the lighter side. Big fluffy white head. The aroma...dear lord the aroma. Very fresh, very clean. Citrusy and fruity. Taste is nice, very well balanced. Those fruity hops (tropical) come to play but there is a malty sweetness that is there as well. Its really, really good. I had no heads up going into this and WOW how pleasantly surprised I am. This is freaking good.
On draft at the Jacks Abby Beer Hall it is a clear golden with an off white head. The aroma is pineapple and the taste is pineapple with hints of grapefruit with a bitter finish
On draft at the Jacks Abby Beer Hall. Pours A clear gold with an off white head. CItrus aroma. Flavors of pineapple, grapefruit and biscuit. Bitter finish.
Pours a hazy golden color with a creamy white head. Notes of lemons, green hops, white grapefruit, honey, and baked bread. very very good.
Bottle thanks to Seth. Pours a clear orange gold with small white head. The aroma is strong tropical fruit and floral. Medium mouth, fruity hop, citrus, light bitterness, good.

Hazy yellow body with a soapy white cap. Aromas of sourdough bread, lager yeast, citrus hops. A balanced beer, with sufficient hop character atop a robust malt bill. Light to medium bitterness. Tasty!

Big thank you to Maxbier for sharing this one. Pours cloudy golden with a white head. Amazing tropical fruit and citrus aroma. Bitter up front followed by big tropical fruit and grapefruit. Finishes with citrus rind bitterness.

Dégustée en compagnie de Marco. Bière blonde plutôt trouble, de couleur jaune pêche qui affiche une mousse bien riche et généreuse. Des arômes fruités au nez. Je ressens du fruit et au-delà du kiwi, une certaine fraise sur une base plutôt granuleuse et beurrée. Un houblon est présent certes, mais celui-ci est très léger. La bière est plutôt construite autours des malts jeunes et dune fermentation Lager si bien faite et équilibrée que jai plutôt limpression dêtre en présence dune Ale (pas trop fan de Lager généralement). Un alcool est indéniable en bouche. Le grain est encore une fois joli et équilibré. Lamertume est moyenne, voire douce, mais le houblon très aromatique en fait une bière légère, douce et très rafraîchissante. Très agréable et facile à boire.

This was poured into a pilsener glass.
The appearance was a slight hazy burnt yellow to golden orange color with a one finger white foamy head that dissipated in a messy fashion. Lacing speckled in a messy fashion.
The smell had a charming sweet to bitter juicy grassy to citrus blend sliding into an underscore of floral bitterness. Hop oils start to come out as it warms. Really nice!
The taste followed the smell nicely. Low dry floral to citrusy aspects burst into the aftertaste and slide into the finish.
On the palate, this one sat about a light to medium on the body with a nice sessionable feel as to not wreck the palate. Carbonation seems good for a lager style - enough smoothness but also enough IBU harshness hitting my tongue.
Overall, Ive wanted this for a long time and am so glad I finally found it. One of the best IPLs, Ive ever had and would recommend with its respected food. But for me, I might like to try with some bleu cheese crusted New York strip steak.
En fût au Prohibition Pig. Une robe dorée avec une mousse pâle. Un nez dagrume, de houblon frais. Une bouche très agréable avec ses notes dagrumes légères. Une finale avec une amertume bien dosée.

Pours a light amber from a bottle. While I like some hoppy beers, I usually roll my eyes at the over-hopped behemoths that many breweries put out. This is not one of those. This is a well-balanced, fruity IPL, lots of bitterness, some nice mellow malt backbone, and an all-around great beer.

First beer of 2016. Lovely looking golden orange perfect head and nose bursting with tropical fruits. Tastes of honey dew, dank weed, mango, kiwi, herbal, some funk, lime citrus. Juicy palate lovely mouthfeel. Very good.
Draft. Golden orange pour with withe head. Light sweet fruit including kiwi and light fruit like hops. Herbal, grassy, but mostly citrus and kiwi fruit hop flavored.
Sampler at the brewery. Golden yellow, hazy with lots of carbonation. Very fruity hops aroma. Sweet flavor up front leading to a lingering bitter finish.

Pint.9 into a glass. Pours a solid marmalade orange. Medium white head, no real lacing retention at all. Aroma of orange peel, orange, wheat, hops, grass, pineapple, grain. Taste of juicy citrus fields, melon, grape, hoppy grass cuttings, soil, zesty peach. Excellent for a lager, quite drinkable, faint booze bug, so relaxing. Winning

Bottle. Pours a bright, mainly clear yellow with a big foamy white head. Aroma had citrus, tropical, and pine notes. Flavor had grapefruit, orange, mango, pineapple, and pine. Very solid brew. Medium body, sticky texture, lively carbonation, and a bitter bite on the finish. Not a big lager fan, but Jacks Abby makes some great ones I enjoy.

500ml bottle pours slightly hazy orange with 2 finger head. Big nose with tons of tropical fruit, mango, orange, grassy citrus and light pine. Palate holds all the notes of the nose with nice bitterness level and just a kiss of light malt toast to back it up. Finishes bitter with long lingering piney tropical fruit, melon, and citrus. Awesome.

Une robe dorée et sa mousse petite mais intéressante pour mon il. Des parfums concentrés de fruits comme une salade exotique arrosée par un sirop légèrement mielleux. Au goût, la base maltée est double tandis que les cultivars apportent un réconfort fruité, gazonné et floral. En bouche, le liquide est plutôt rond, pétillant et huileux. La finale est modérément amère, très fruitée comme une bière qui exploite ses houblons de glorieuse façon.

Une bière dorée ayant une mousse baveuse qui laisse des traces communes. Un nez houblonné et fruité; particulièrement pas lananas cuit, chauffé avec des élans sucrés. Le goût et aussi fruité, il est crémeux et on a limpression de dessert, de gâteau, de sucre et fruits confits. Leffervescence aide au transport du liquide, la rendant facile à boire. (1672-031215)

This is a great beer. Huge pine and pineapple aroma. Some citrus peel and grapefruit. Pours golden with decent lacing, some initial head. Bitter finish. Light sweet malt. Great balance. Tap at Lord Hobo.

pours a pale golden with 2 finger head that lingers, leaving mild/moderate lacing. Prominent citrusy hops with some pine and hint of resin in it. toasted malt. heavy bitter hops, but very pleasant & juicy. moderate mouthfeel, moderate carbonation. long bitter finish. this is excellent.
Strong citrus and hop aromas, golden with a nice cloudiness to it. Strong hops at the front, with citrus after taste and a bit of alcohol note to the finish
Bottle from SJ. Notes of Lemon, Citrus, pepper and bread. Hoppy finish...not bad at all.

Cloudy straw-coloured, sudsy white head, streaky legs. Smells of very dry resinous hop, yeast, dry grass, lightly herbal pine needles, pepper, orange peel, guava, lemon. Tastes of deeply bitter piney hop, resin, light pepper, grapefruit, tangerine. Body is medium, very smooth, fluffy finish - palate is heavier than expected for a lager and very nice. Excellent, especially as it warms up.

Bottle from Bottle Shop at home. Slightly translucent straw yellow pour with thin dense head. Color is almost like pee. Aroma is unusual - first very straight lager aroma, then lots of fruity hops. Not used to the combination. Taste is good. Big bitter/tartness and fruity floral hops. Deep resinous hops at the end with malt and booze that lasts. Palate is richer than I expected but not syrupy, but retains a little bit of lager crispness. Really good.
Draft. Glowing hazy orange with a thin white head. Aroma is floral with bready malt. Taste follows and adds a hint of tangerine. Thinnish crisp mouthfeel. Very good.

En fût. Verre de 12 oz déguste chez Farmhouse Tap & Grill (Burlington, VT) au coût de 6,50$. Arôme: Légère odeur dagrumes. Apparence: La couleur est blonde avec une très faible densité de bulle. Présence dun mince col mousseux et dune fine dentelle le verre. Saveur: Goût dagrumes avec une pointe de fruits de la passion. Longue durée de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement onctueuse. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Arrière goût houblonné. (Rating #6148)

Bottle dated 10/30/2014. 
Aroma has a moderate pilsner grain malt and bread note. Moderate tropical fruit, mostly pineapple and mango with moderate citrus notes of orange and tangerine. A hint of a grassy hop note. 
Pours a very cloudy, pale golden straw color with a large, fairly thick, slightly off white head with good retention. High amounts of lacing. 
Flavor has a light sweetness with medium light grain and bread notes. High bitterness with a hint of alcohol spice. Moderately strong citrus notes of mandarin, tangerine and orange with lighter grapefruit. Medium light tropical fruit notes of mango and pineapple along with some melon. 
Mouthfeel is medium to medium full bodied with medium carbonation. Low astringency and medium low alcohol warmth. 
Overall, a pretty nice beer. Not sure its crisp and dry enough to really stand out as a lager in my mind, but nice nonetheless. Lots of hop character and bitterness, but I do wonder if it was different when fresher.

Pours a hazy blonde with a generous white head, lasting a good while, leaving a nice lace. Loads of Berry aromas with white grapes à long with something minty. Medium body, smooth carbonation, tons of kiwi hops shining with Nelson heading the way. Nice drinkability with good bitterness. Very good.
From a bottle into a goblet.The pour is a unfiltered yellow with a bitter wheat light body light cirrus beer.

Pours a hazy gold with a thick white head. Aroma is citrus and passion fruit. Taste is passion fruit, citrus and grape fruit. I would like a little more malt to balance the big hop flavor but its still delicious as it is. Very tasty beer.

My Bottom Line:
This lean and citrusy Double IPA shares white grapes, citrus fruit and resinous angles for a dangerously drinkable and flavorful example.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A slice of foam tops the golden.
-This is not a dank IPA like many others brewed in the northeast.
-The mouthfeel is as svelte as can be for the style.
-The soft effervescence serves drinkability quite well.

On tap at Farmhouse Tap and Grill, Burlington.

Bottle dated 11/4. Pours a cloudy straw yellow with one finger of head that subsides into a ring of sticky lacing. Aroma is dank and stinky tropical fruit, orange peel, honey, sweet malts, spicy hops, rye bread, acetone, grass, pine. Taste is a mixture of juicy mango and chewy malts with an unusual spicy note coming through and a bit of booze. Finish of grapefruit peel and soapy, woody hops  serious raw hop pellet flavor. Like Mass Rising, this one is underwhelming, a little heavy and messy.

Bottle thanks matt_ducharme poured hazy gold a nice lacy white head. Citrus and passion fruit explode in the nose with little under tones of wet hops. Taste had overprowering amountof grapefruit, passion fruit, and floral hops with light malt. Very crisp finishing dry.

Bottle shared by duchammer thanks to Matt_ducharme: Poured a hazy straw color with a huge frothy head (I poured it like an asshole). Right to the nose hops can almost taste it. Nice fruity hops taste, very sessionable and soft finish.

Pale yellow pour with a thick white head. The aroma has a really bright lemon and citrus note. A bit of very lean malt and a bit of honey. Slightly fruity with a touch of light bitterness. A little bit fruity with some grapey flavour. A little bit peppery.
500ml bottle pours a hazy golden color without much head. Nice hop flavors to balance the malt. Marmalade.

Bottle. Pours a hazed gold with a medium sized white head. Big sticky citrus and a bit of malt. Medium bodied, a touch of grain with nice citrus notes. Sticky citrus moves into a long grapefruit bitterness on the finish.
0,5 pullo@ Valtteri. Hitusen samea kullankeltainen. Tuoksussa raikasta hedelmää, humalaa, sitrusta, kukkaisuutta, hiukan mallasta. Maussa humalaa, sitrusta, kesäyön metsää.

0,5l bottle from Bauer Wine & Spirits, Boston. Pours cloudy yellow with a medium head. Aroma is very crisp hops with fruits and malts. Flavor is malts with plenty of hoppy bitterness and some fruits and alcohol. Sturdy palate. Nice.

Bottle: Pour is cloudy light golden, with a frothy stark white head into this glass -it retains well, with sticky lacing present - The nose is bright, citrus, bready, florals, with that tangerine earthiness from the new zealand additions. Im not sure which one I like better (Mass or Kiwi), and while I didnt have them quite side by side, Im leaning towards this variant. Its juicy, citrus, bittering, with more sweet bread and earthy notes, and yet the finish is clean, floral, with a hint of cream - I suppose Ive yet to have better -

Pours a clear gold with light white head. Has a grainy and citrus hop aroma. Taste is a mix of a pilsner and IPA with grains, citrus hops, pine and light malts. Lingering taste of bitter hops and dry grains.

Bottle 500ml. Thanks Tommy.
Pours clear blond with low-medium white head. Good lacing. Aroma is of pepper, citrus, tropical fruits, pine, resin. Taste is of pepper, citrus, tropical fruits, bitterness, alcohol, pine, resin. Palate: Medium-full bodied. Soft-medium carbonation. Overall: Awesome. Drinkable.

bottle from tom10101, may thanks bro! pours almost cloudy yet bright yellow with a very nice white head, good retention and lacing. fragrant citrus, grapefruit, clean fruitiness - in fact it is very fruity and juicy - melons, fat white grapes, chardonnay-like, fruit salad; gently polished lightly doughy honeyed malts, clean yeast, ginger, pepper. light carbonation, medium body - oily and not too heavy, balanced spicy-citrusy finish. excellent stuff.

500 ml Bottle with a date of 10/30/2014stamped on neck, yes!! Thanks Jacks Abby for the date! Shared two ways. Slightly hazy gold with lasting foamy head in a pilsner glass. Aroma is lots of citrus with grapefruit upfront and a ton of grassy, Saaz type hints. 
 Moderate level of pilsner malt body in a highly hopped profile. Massively grassy, mildly citrus fruits with a nice lingering hop bite. Imperial Pils that drinks like a well hopped IPA. Light crisp body makes this a beer you can chug. Get this brew fresh it rocks!

Bottle (500 ml). Slightly hazy bright golden with a medium easy to revive fluffy off-white head and good lacing. Aroma is really hoppy with intense fruitiness (citrus, tropical fruits, papaya) and major floral presence too along light sweetness and doughy cereals. Taste is moderately/medium sweet with grapefruits, floral presence, doughy cereals and medium bitterness. Medium body. Moderate/medium carbonation. A tad oily mouthfeel. Dry and bitter finish. Sticky aftertaste. Intensely hoppy. Quite tasty, but not the easiest to drink from Jacks Abby. I liked it though.
Bottle from shop in Burlington. Drank from bottle, like its my job. Aroma is strong hoppy aroma, like melon. Taste is the same, hoppy, some citrus, strong melon, finished fruity sweet.

Pours a slightly hazy light golden color with a crazy thick white head which is very bubbly. Aroma is loaded with hops right up front. Pine, grapefruit, malts, a little skunk and burnt hair (I know it sounds weird) also come into play. This head seriously took close to 5 mins to subside! Oily and heavy palate. Flavor is of citrus, hops, pine, slight booze, a little sweetness in the background, and some more hops. Very fresh hop balanced. Leaves a nice hoppy finish. Much better tasting than what I was expecting. Complex. Good stuff.
Hazy apricot, small white head. Aroma of citrus, grass, and spicy hops. Flavor is tangerine, orange, mango, grass, floral hops, caramel.

pours a light gold pilsner color. Doesnt quite have the aroma of a pilsner. Smells of citrus and hops like most IPLs or IPAs. Definitely get the hop bitterness right up front mixed with this indistinct fruitiness, which I assume is the kiwi. A very pleasant light/medium body.

Pour is lightly hazed pale golden orange with a ton of tight white head. Nose is strong, presents a nice balance of assertive grains, lightly toasty with notes of bread and a touch of dough. Very strong hops behind, grassy and strong citrus and tart grapefruit. Taste is even more juicy hops, still has a solid grain bill, bread crust mixed with dough. Hops are juicy and bright, tropical fruits and some tart grapefruit, assertive bitterness through the finish. Clean airy body with strong carbonation, great stuff.

On draught at Blue Tusk. Light amber with a creamy head. This was a bit of an odd aroma for me that combined a lager and a DIPA - pilsener, somewhat tropical with pineapple and some orange rind. Moderate carbonation and odd body, booze comes through a bit more towards the end as things dry out a bit and it becomes more bitter but this was just odd.

500 ml bottle poured a hazy gold with a small lasting off white head. Aromas of straw, mango, peach, melon and tangerine. Palate was light bodied and smooth with a dry finish. Flavors of straw, citrus and earthiness with a smooth dry bitter finish.

Im am seriously impressed here. This is one of those beers that takes brewing into a new area that hasnt been done before. India Pale Lagers are a new trend, that in my humble opinion, have not been perfected, because if what you want is a well made hoppy beer, then why not have an IPA, why go to all the trouble to find a lager, but this was different. Instead of trying to hide the fact that its a lager and confuse the palate, this celebrated being a lager, and used the New Zealand hops to great effect. Get your hands on this one.
Very strong hop aroma followed by a strong hop flavor. This beer has a full taste but a bit too happy for me.

500 ml. bottle. Thanks Mike! Pours a cloudy gold with a nice white head. Aroma of citrus and other tropical fruit. Taste is grapefruit, lemon, other tropical fruit, pine, grain, and malt. Very good. Not sure of what style it is, but who cares.
Wiggle. My back hurts. This did not help as much as i had hoped. Strong citrus hops on pale malt. Pale malts shine tbru with the crisp pine hop flowing till abrupt finish.

Fresh 2014 bottle, drunk 2/22/14So after buying this about 3 weeks ago, I left it in the fridge and it STILL will not clarify. I dont understand! Either this is some very non-flocculent lager yeast (seems very doubtful) or these hop particles just wont settle. Either way, the beer is still hazy, albeit not terribly so and deep sunny-orange colored with a clumpy white head that is well retained (in clumps...). Lots of lacing.Very bitter and piney, this reminds me much of the ABCS (which I didnt rate due to the same annoying resistance to the sediment dropping out). Lush green, leafy resinous hops are backed by a mostly dry pale malt sweetness, while some earthy tones from the hops and a touch of doughiness from the yeast persist. Bright and crisp citrus notes break through on the very end and increase with warming, but its just not 100% bright hop aroma due to the sediment.Pillowy malts provide ample body, as a creamy carbonation aids in balancing the hop assault as well. Pine, grapefruit rind and lots of lemon all build up on the palate, crescendoing in to a bitter, but not obnoxiously so, finish that is robbed of some of its resin sting thanks to the comforting malt texture and sugars. Really nice mouthfeel, not even too out of balance, but I just dont care for the hop flavor really. Its tons of tangy, almost sour pininess and extremely dry ctirus rind. I can see why this gets the rating it does, but not my cup of tea. On the plus side, my second bottle of ABCS has finally gone clear after sitting in the fridge for 2 weeks.

A: Hazy yellow/golden color with a strong white/foamy head with nice retention and sticky lacing down the sides. 

S: Pine upfront with tropical fruit, melon, grapefruit, and some nuttiness.

T: Like the aroma, piney, citrus and tropical fruit, some grapefruit, a little pineapple, and again a little nutty.

M: Light to medium bodied with medium to high carbonation. Smooth and easy drinking. Kind of chalky.

O: Decent beer was hoping it was better fresh and it is just slightly, if I were able to regularly get this I would be inclined to drink this every so often.

Is this an imperial lager, or is it a IIPA. Not sure where one ends and the other begins. Pours pale and almost clear with nice white head. Reminiscent of the newest Victory IIPA. Starts like a IIPA finishes clean and crisp like a lager. Nice beer that I was glad to share with my little brother. Bottle - Received in Trade

Pours a golden-orange, nice fluffy white head. Aroma is sharp with citrus hops, some malty sweetness and a hint of booze. Taste follows the aroma nicely. Lots of big hop flavors. Bitter and slightly boozy but balanced by a big malt profile and the ensuing sweetness. Very nice lager.
Bottle to snifter. Pours a golden orange with a rather large head. Citrus, floral and resin on the nose. Very nicely hoppy on the tongue with a decent malt backing. Somewhat sweet. Nicely intense.

.5 liter bottle. It pours a nice semi-clear golden orange with a huge, fluffy white head. The aroma is bready with big hop character. Grapefruit, gooseberries and strong florals backed up by fresh baked bread. Very nice. The flavor is an onslaught of hop goodness. Sweet grape, grapefruit, and peach backed up by a dry spicy character finishing with a floral bitterness in the back of the mouth. Not much malt character save a bit of honey and bread on the palate to smooth things out. Amazing beer. Ive been floored by the hoppy pilsners coming from these guys.

Pours a hazed golden lager color with yellow hues with the orangey blush of a peach on it. Pastel eye candy. It had a 3 finger head of soft creamy bone white foam that sat like cloud over the top of the beer fo the longest time before it fell. left Grand splotchy thick lace. Oh so pretty.

Nose is righteous! This one has soft ripe peach for a nose with tropical back notes and a little bit of cat pee as it warms. Grass, lemon grass a white grape sweetness that seem to keep each other in check. The kiwi hops remind me of the nelson sauvin hops int heir grapey sweetness and powdery perfumey lightness. The malt is a pinch of sugar.

Taste is well done. My compunction with this style beer is because of the high abv it often feels like these beers are trying to put themselves together with pieces that dont fit. This one is a bit different. It has a light lager type smoothness to the drink that is not undone by the higher abv. There is a touch of warmth from alcohol on the palate and the mouthfeel is medium and smooth. The fruit is ripe and juicy, peach tropical backnotes and lemon grass. There is a wine like sweetness to the drink. The cat pee/dank is scent only and in the drink there is a moderate bitter that takes the back end . Light sugary malt. Crisp but has sweet scents from alcohol that I do not think belong in the lagerbier.

This is one of the beers in this style that actually drinks well. Its not a lager in that you cannot have tow, three or even four. It drinks a bit sweet and with an alcohol presence BUT the fruit and the choice of hops on this have made it work. The pale malt is at its best to smooth everything out an leave the palate dry and even a bit refreshed with plenty of carbonation to excite the tongue.

Bottle. Pours pale golden yellow with small white head. Aroma fresh grassy hops and a little sweet malt. Medium body, crisp mouthfeel. Flavor herbal and citrus hops, off-dry, nice overall. So after black and white IPAs, now when have Lager IPAs? Always nice to try something new.
Gold with a white head. Nose is florals, heavy grapefruit, grainy, fresh hops, and crisp. Easy palate, bitter, grapefruit, florals, and a nice finish.

[Bottle (500ml)] Pours a slightly hazy gold with a huge lasting frothy off-white head. Some lacing on the glass. Aroma or hops first and foremost followed by some sweetness, bready malt and light vegetal notes. Flavour is hoppy and Lager-ish, which is interesting, along with fruit, bready malt and a long moderate bitter finish. Alcohol is well hidden. An enjoyable beer but the idea doesnt quite work for me.
Best of class. A very tasty ipl, with authentic New Zealand kiwi taste, and citrus. Very fresh bottle from Premier Gourmet, very drinkable. Lasting head. Fruity hoppy aroma. Seek out.
orange amber, white foam head. nose full of citrus. taste follows, good bitterness held by a solid pale malt core.

Pour out of bottle, thanks Levi! Hazy orange pour with white head, aroma brought notes of cat pee, hints of stone fruits, peach, some slight grapefruit into some spice, piney notes in there, touch of biscuit. Taste is a mix of cat pee, grapefruit, some slight orange into pine, spice, hints of biscuit, bread, finishing fairly bitter.

Thanks Eric

Bottle pourer a hazy golden orange, three finget head. Smell was floral, citrusy lemon peel. 

Taste had a burst of intense hoppiness, followed by a sweet malt fruit character. Really well balanced beer
Bottle shared by Levi - light hazy yellow pour. Funky nose, with a slight leaning to grapefruit. Strong bitter finish.

Pours out a slightly hazy yellow/orange with a huge tan head, nice to look at in a tulip glass. Amazing juicy citrus notes, some floral scents and a bit of alcohol to the aroma. Taste follows the aroma, but some dank weedy notes creep into the flavor. Sweet malt provides a clean backing and contrasts with the alcohol. Great mouthfeel, thick and sticky with a little alcohol heat. Really tasty fall beer, $5 for a 16 oz bottle. I think I prefer Mass Rising a little bit more, and its available more often.

Clear straw yellow color. Dense white head with small bubbles. Nice floral notes in aroma. Coriander maybe. Taste is nice and malty considering the strong hoppy smells. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Aroma is tropical fruit, mango, pineapple, and warm bread. Appearance is bright gold with excellent clarity. Dense with head and nice lacing. Taste is passion fruit, pineapple, papaya, straw, and some grassy notes. Medium light body, clean finish. Overall very enjoyable and an interesting style.
Big citrus aroma and flavor. I really liked it. A lot of good hop flavors and very drinkable. Definitely good use of the kiwi.

Bottle: thanks, Chris! Golden, mostly clear body (looked filtered) with a big, voluptuous white foam capping it off. Aroma is mostly full of fruity, citric hops with oranges, citrus, & grapefruit abound. Not sure if these hops are supposed to smell like actual kiwis, but I dont get much kiwi smell. Grass, leaves, some lighter pine notes. Taste is crisp with a big citrus peel presence, among other notes of grapefruit, tangerine, & maybe pineapple. Sharp with big leafy pine notes. Nice bready malt backbone & a crisp, super clean finish thanks to the yeast. Very well attenuated. I thought this beer was really good, though it didnt quite meet the large expectations I had for it (I much preferred Hoponius Union).

Bottle thanks to BroBoostIPA. Pours super hazy gold with a persistent half-inch of white head. Super grainy/biscuity aroma. Taste is biscuit, cracker, juicy fruit, citrus. Some apple and cherry notes. Real thick mouthfeel. Real easy drinking for a fairly high-boost brew.

Bottle @ home, courtesy of tenderloineshawn213. Thanks shithead. Fair amount of yeast sludge in the upper neck of the bottle. Pours a somewhat cloudy yellow orange appearance with a lasting off white head. Aroma is massively spicy/dank hoppy with white wine and lots of grapefruit. The hops is seriously out of control on this one. Theyre very nice, full of fruit, guava, and dank weedy notes, but its almost a bit too much. Malt backbone is nice and beer is dry enough. Very bitter and even a touch goopy. I guess I like most of my lagers in the low boost range and not quite so bitter, but it is kind of fun to drink. 8.5 % = medium boost

500mL bottle, sent from Gregg657 (thanks a lot, Pete), pours a hazy golden with a large foamy white head. Aroma brings out dry fruity kiwis, loads of piney hops, and grapefruit rind - what a beautifully subtle nose this has to it. Flavour is just as wonderful, with loads of dry juicy kiwi fruits, some grapefruit, piney hops, a little grass, and some soft dry cerealy malt. So juicy, dry and drinkable, with remarkable elegance. Finishes on dry grassy and kiwi-y notes. Awesome stuff.

&*$&! yeah, this is how you should hop a lager.. though the nose rocks the taste is just great.. the lager finish throws off the balance, I respect the ideals of JA but ale yeast would make this dynomite! almost tough to drink after 5 sips because of how contrasting the lager finish is with the juicy hops.

UPDATED: DEC 13, 2013 So, apparently this is the #1 rated Imperial Pils In the world. Lets see how it stacks up. 

Pours a clear gold color with a nice white head. Big, powerful aromas of juicy tropical fruits in the nose. Mango, pineapple, grapefruit with sugar, your senses just run wild when you smell this beer. Very deep and complex aromas. I could smell this for hours. 

Taste is a slight letdown from what the aroma promised. No, its still pretty damn good, but not up there with the best of the best ipas/dipas Ive ever tasted. Probably the best lager Ive ever had though. Some of the tropical fruit juice is lost in translation from the nose. Some unwelcomed bitterness is present, detracting from the overall experience. Very thin body for a 8.5% beer. The finish is drying, Tylenol like bitterness with only a shadow of the tropical fruit hop expression promised in the nose. 
Its good, but not a world beater.

On tap at the Publick House - Pours hazy amber with a foamy white head. Nose is pungent hops--tropical fruit, grass, pine--with a grainy, lightly yeast malt base. Taste is more on the grass/pine side of things, wiht a bit of doughy yeastiness and more graininess. Medium and smoothly carbonated. Good but not great.

Bottle. Poured a nice golden color. Smell is very subdued with a little bit of floral aroma. Taste is similar - very light and the high ABV content is well-hidden. Overall I wouldve liked a little more bite from it.

bottle thanks to forcabrew. Pours a slightly hazy deep gold color. very large white head. nose is moderate berry like fruitiness. taste is initially bitter and clean. late in the finish the hop flavor kicks in and is interesting. Not sure about the south of the equator hops. enjoyable. no sign of alcohol. maybe a touch of sulfur. good. not great.
Bottle, pours a bright yellow, aroma is citrusy and taste is very citrusy a nice fruity ipa taste, not what you would expect from a lager. Overall pretty tasty

500 ml bottle thanks to WillRunForBeer. Pours a hazy gold color with a huge, rocky head that fades slowly and never completely goes away. Aroma is fairly intense, fresh cut grass, flowers, tropical fruit, grape skins, and kiwi. Taste is not a good as the aroma though. Ultra dry and very bitter. Kinda like chewing on flowers and fruit skins. Very foamy carbonation too. Definitely well made beer but I never really seem to enjoy the New Zealand hops ever. Just like this beer, I always love their aroma but not the taste.
Light straw color, plenty of white head and lace. Piney, earthy, spicy hops are a bit sharp. Dry as bone, finishes with a kiss of caramel. Well made, despite being not exactly my style.
(500ml bottle) cloudy medium gold, soapy white bubbles. Nose is very tropical, sweet citrus zest, lemon, orange pulp, guava. Taste of pine, umami, super dry, linger not my favorite, earthy.
At Thomas. Pours Oliver clear orange Witt light lacing aroma is thin, clean rye, earthy dirt hops. Taste is very earthy dirty, hay, meaty.

500ml bottle into a tulip glass. Pours a hazy amber peach color which is uncharacteristic of Jacks usual crystal clear lagers. Two fingers of stubborn off-white foam with a dollop of snow-white foam which forms on top as it settles down. Crazy lacing. This beer looks amazing. Aroma is pretty potent with heavy notes of New Zealand hops. Cantaloupe, mango, papaya, and a dank resinous finish with some fusel heat. The taste follows with bright and juicy mango and melons which fade into dank grass and grains in the aftertaste. A bit too boozy and bitter. Comes off a bit harsh as opposed to Jacks usual crisp and clean lagers. This beer really does feel like its let go of its "lagerness". As much as I love the New Zealand hop varietals, this beer just seems to dilute what makes these IPLs so amazing. Still damn tasty, but not as drinkable and clean as the rest of their lineup.

Bottle @ GTs house. Clear golden orange pour with a white head. Really nice nose. Grapefruit, pine, biscuit, and peach. Good amount of orange in there, too. Flavor has some nice hops, but is quite bitter and a touch astringent. Grapefruit, orange rind, and lots of pine. Mild biscuit and a touch of booze.

Yes. This is the Lager that I have been looking for. The aroma is grapefruit and fresh-cut grass. The citrus and herbal flavors continue in the taste. The light-lager body and subtle carbonation are great. This is extremely flavorful and dangerously drinkable. I should buy a case.
draft at Blue Monk, Buffalo NY. golden orange pour. great bitterness, floral, citrus forward hops, medium to fuller bodied. very drinkable, great flavor. very nice

Aroma: Onions, Garlic, Mildly Piney

Appearance: Mildly Hazy Golden Straw Hue, Passes Most Light, Thin White Head Ring, Minimal Lacing

Taste: Onions and Oranges

Mouthfeel: Average Carbonation, Medium Bodied, Mildly Drying

Sampled @ Mass Brewers Fest @ Julios. Poured deep gold with a foamy white head. Strong hop forward aroma. Clears out the sinuses. Quite bitter with lots of hoppiness in the flavor. Some fruitiness and malt to the back end. Medium bodied with a bitter finish.

Tap. Pours hazy golden, small white head, decent lacing. Aroma is kiwi(!), citrus, dank. Flavor is much the same, vaguely fruity, tropical, initial sweetness that dries out fast. Medium bitter. Medium body, oily mouthfeel. Pretty tasty.
Golden pour with a thin white cap. Aroma of white grape, Pine, Grapefruit. Fairly bitter, Pine and tropical fruit, Grapefruit, Floral. Slight bit of alcohol detected in the finish. Medium body.
Pours golden on color with an off white head. The aroma consists of Nelson with notes of melon, grass and pine. Rather bitter

Bottle to glass. Bottled 4 days ago! Clean gold amber pour with a huge white head. Nose is very crisp; grass clippings, citrus, sweet hoppiness. Taste is sweet and earthy. Definitely very fresh hops going on here. Grass, grapefruit, citrus, earthy malt finish. Not overpowering bitter or sweet. Nice balance.

Finally I get to try this: wicked excited! $2.70 for the 4oz glass at the Grog served earlier today. Pours a sandy amber yellowish-golden with a trim, sudsy whitish ringed head. Aromas of white wine lees, Sauvignon blanc grapes, New Zealand hops, sea salt, king Edward potatoes, vitamins, and blueberries. Tastes of piney and citrus hops, LME, and Bavaria yeast. Krill oil and spelt by swallow. Hate to say it, but I was expecting more.

Hazy orange pour. Light cream head with seemingly permanent head retention. Giant grapefruit and pine aroma. Tons of fruit flavors, including lemon, grapefruit, peach, lime and watermelon. Serious bitterness in the finish. Pine resin dominates any malt that might be present. I like he way the clean lager character works with the hops and leaves them exposed and delicate. The only problem is that it leaves the beer a bit delicate, which is at odds with the aggressive bitterness. There seems to be a threshold on how big an IPL can reasonably be and this pushes that boundary. Still really tasty and really enjoyable, but unbalanced.

Draft. Pours yellow orange with light white head that lingers. Cloudy with light carbonation. Toasted bread flavors upfront with hop bite in the back. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Sharp hop aroma, contrasted with with some buttery and soapy malts. Glowing yellow, lasting lacy head. Tropical fruit flavor thats somewhat gamey. To that note, the body has an oily feel to it. Unique stuff, I rate weird either very high or very low, so well leave it at that.
Pale golden yellow with small white head. Aroma fresh grassy hops and a little sweet malt. Medium body, crisp mouthfeel. Flavor herbal and citrus hops, off-dry, not too complex but nice overall.

UPDATED: NOV 12, 2013 500mL extremely fresh bottle (<1 week old) thanks to WillRunForBeer! Pours a low haze bright orange. Thick, white foam. Incredible lacing. Nose is beautiful soft flowers, orange marmalade, pale grist, mild DMS. Taste is pretty hefty alcohol wise, slightly abrasive. Palate is a bit chalky. Abv is a bit much. Wish it was toned down. The Pro-Am Pils kicked this one in the pants. Still, very good.500mL second bottle, super fresh. Great foam, great retention. Awesome juicy kumquat nose, fresh grapefruit, really solid. Taste is super bitter, almost like eating raw radicchio, endive, and some gorgonzola cheese. Dusty, chalky palate. Surprisingly harsh with big alcohol presence. Cant get down with it sadly.
500 ml bottle thanks to WillRunForBeer. Big hoppy aroma. Tropical fruit. Some bitterness. Extremely tasty. Maybe best imperial pils Ive had.

500ml bottle in a tulip and sampled at the brewery. Both pretty similar. Pours hazy golden with a lacy, off-white head. Aroma strong of fruity and citrusy and floral hops plus a nice pale and caramel maltiness. Flavor the same with a nice, strong, fruity hoppiness. Average to smooth texture. A really good beer, with a very unique hop character.

Bright transparent gold color, frothy white head. Juicy fruits such as melon, grapefruit, peach, citrus, and kiwi. Hay in the background. Sweetness initially and finishes on a resiny bitter note more reminiscent of dried orange peel. Lively, smooth, but a tad oily. Long bitter finish in part from the alcohol content

Sample from a 500 ml bottle. Pours a hazy yellow color with a medium sized white head. The aroma has melon, citrus, kiwi, herbal with light floral notes. The flavor has tropical fruit, kiwi, melon, herbal notes. Clean, easy to drink. Packs a ton of flavor for a lager with mild plus bitterness to the finish.
Un bouquet assez unique, je sais que jai à faire à qqch de spécial, ananas, kiwi, banane, orange. Belle texture juteuse, jaime de plus en plus le côté lager dans une bombe houblonnée.

Bottle.  Bright straw/golden color with a thick lacing white head of foam.  Hops hit big up front with a nice white wine and orange blossom note.  Taste has that lager crispness with a touch of bread and cereal grain.  Hops are present in the flavor, but with a subtle bitterness.  Carbonation level is high and the mouth feel is very clean and just the right weight on the tongue. Finished with a touch of grain and some lingering slightly vegetal hops.  Overall a really tasty beer and a style that I wish more breweries made.  This bottle was also a couple months old, would love to get my hands on a fresh one right from the brewery.

Glowing golden pour with a craggy white head.  Aroma is sweet tropical fruits, dank piny hops with a touch of sweet grass and melon.  Flavor is lovely sweet melon, some papaya, with piney bitter hops.  Begins sweet but finishes dry and smacking.  Juicy, punchy, and wonderfully refreshing.  These guys know how to make a lager.

À loeil : belle opacité et assez trouble pour une lager (non-filtrée il faut noter)
Au nez : Belle odeur dense de fruits exotiques  (pamplemousse, ananas, papaye)
Au goût : Le nez suit à lentrée avec les agrumes en majorité. Lamertume se faufile ensuite pour rendre la finale très consistante et houblonnée. 

Dans ma jeune histoire avec les bières, la meilleure que jai bu ! Très équilibrée, intense et rafraîchissante !

November 12 bottle from a dude on BA - thanks!  Pours a brilliant hazy and glowing yellow/gold with a massive froth of rocky, white foam.  Brilliant appearance.  Aroma is floral hop notes with minimal bitterness and a very clean, dry malt backbone.  Taste is clean, dry balanced hop bitterness over a tight malt profile that shows minimal sweetnes and light grainy, toasted notes.  Very dry and clean mouthfeel.  Great beer and Id love to get a hold of a fresher bottle.

Bottle thanks to jleblanc. Slightly hazy yellow pour with white head. Aroma is peppery, spicy, fruity hops, tons and tons of hops, a real aroma bomb, very enticing. Taste is bitter but very smooth and clean, nice lager properties, grapefruity finish. Palate is smooth and very drinkable, excellent.

500 ml bottle shared by Kan. Thanks. Pours a hazy straw yellow hue, good haze, a bit pale with frothy whitish head atop. Aromas are citrusy, kiwi, and melon. Florals and lemon mix with some pale malts, grain, and gentle sweetness. Nice nose that starts to grow on me, kiwi and citrus. Initial is medium bodied, lighter end of the fold showing big kiwi fruit, lemons, and florals. Some grass, a touch resiny and rind like. Firm solid bitterness up front, some tropical fruit, bread, grain and gumball into the middle. Dry and hoppy finish is firm, citrusy and floral. Kiwi element really does strike that flavor well. A bit sweet intothe middle and backend at times but the finish brings dryness back, a touch of gumball sweetness, melon. Solid beer. Interesting hop, fun to pull the Kiwi out here.
World class.  Nothing more nothing less.  Intense hop aroma with citrus and pine.  Unfiltered.  Taste is very bitter but long and not cloying.  Drink.

Bottle thanks to ILOVESTOUTS, served in a Hill Farmstead stem. 

Pour: Hazy golden yellow. Really vibrant and almost glowing. Big two and a have finger fluffy, snow white head. Leaves tons of clean sticky lacing. Beautiful.

Smell: Big grapefruit, melon, and pine right off the bat. Some light breadyness, but barely. Not super big on the nose but really bright.

Taste: Woah. HUGE grapefruit, melons, and clean pine, followed by a deep citrus bitterness. Just bright all around. This beer is standout. A nice bread dough sweetness just supplements This is no where close to balance, and I love it.

Mouthfeel: It drinks like a Hill Farmstead DIPA. To me, that about the highest mouthfeel praise there is. Incredibly juicy, this beer approaches S&S5 levels of drinkability. Great bitterness, but in the raw fruit sense. Amazing.

Overall: This beer is better than nearly every DIPA Ive ever had. Just a stellar beer in every regard. Jacks Abbey hit a grand slam here. I dont want this again, I NEED this again.
Pours really cloudy white head. Aroma of honey dew melon, lychee, kiwi, lime. Flavors are real tropically, kiwi, honeydew, limes, resiny hops. Really clean. Easy drinking. Great flavor.

500ml bottle.  thanks to shawn. almost through the jack abby lineup - wish i had more... bottle yields a hazy pale golden yellow brown consistency, predominantly opaque actually with little light passing through. the pour is topped with a creamy film of frothy white head.. aroma somewhat muted at first but a seedy juicy fruit flavor definetely rears its head and comes to the forefront.  dank with melon fruitiness once again with that added seedy quality to it that one would normally find from a berry fruit... flavors have more of that seedy dank tropical fruit focus upfront.  quite assertive actually and unique in its own right.  medium bodied or just above with an adequate carbonation level.  odd at first but the hop character developed more after warming. different and good for that matter. none of these jack abby brews have actually disappointed in any way whatsoever.
Ya this stuff is stupid good. A frigging big bad hoppy lager. If you dont believe me give it a try.
A lager...wow!  So freakin amazing.  Tastes like a full blown IPA with sticky mouthfeel, resin, and big pine and slight citrus hops.  I loved this!
Bottle. Pours a cloudy golden with a big white head. Big citrusy hop aroma. Tastes and feels like a top notch Imperial IPA yet this is a lager. Kinda reminds me of a Dogfish 90. This is good stuff.
Nice gold pour, white head. Juicy hops up front, unripe stone friuit, grass, citrus peel.  Flavor is awesome.  So juicy, fruity, grassy, lightly bitter, but so juicy and tasty.

Cloudy orange, huge white head. Citrusy aroma, with some sweet notes in there, too. I get a little vanilla, too. Nicely full bodied. Flavor is a nice mix of dry, woody pine mixed some fruity, citrusy flavors. I like this a lot. Thanks to m Winter 2012 Secret Santa!

Bottle @ Chriso. Pours a slightly hazy yellow color with a longlasting white head. Has a fruity malty peachy hoppy aroma. Fruity malty peachy hoppy flavor. has a sweetish malty grainy peachy hoppy finish.

50cl bottle pours a hazy gold with some spitty, white head.  Nose is very inviting, perfume, limes, lemon zest, honey, light pine, chive.  Flavor is very bright, lime, grapefruit, zesty garlic, onion shoots, orange.  Really nice and balanced.  Medium bodied, peppy finish.

Bottle thanks to Ernesto. Pours a hazy light orange with a modest white head. Aroma is a little off. Some pepper and almost smoke and ash. Maybe some nuts. Taste is hoppy at the front with a medium mouthfeel that by the end has a lot of the heat from the beer. Havent had many hot beers like this. Overall, interesting but having just had a Pizza Port Imperial Pale Lager last week this one just doesnt stand up to it from a hop perspective.
user_location: Morro Bay via Orange County, California, USA

text:
Bottle at Chriso tasting (thanks Chris) 18/11/12.
Lightly hazed pale blonde with a thin white head that soon clears to the edge and leaves a film.
Nose is pine, kiwi fruit, big tropical fruit hit on the nose.
Tastes pine forward, light burnt notes, bitter orange, hint of mango, grapefruit.
Medium bodied with bite, bitter dry finish.
Decent!
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Strong Pale Lagers you got served!....  Well this beer is fantastic.  Pours a copper/honey golden pour with nice 1 finger foamy head.  Aroma is grapefruit, melon, light cracker and dough.  Taste is grassy herbal hops with tons of citrus flavor.  Juicy and drinkable.. this is actually 8.5%???

Draft @ Ale House. Pours a nice golden color with a stickt three finger head. On the nose its got a nice citrus, tangerine fruit forward aroma with a backbone of earthy straw. On the palate its a lot of the same with anice mouthfeel brought on by medium carbonation giving it a full round body that has a juicy start and flows nicely into an earthy, straw, rustic hop finish.
Great citrus hop flavors, very clean like most of their offerings, a great fan of this

Growler at franks With Vinny, Alan, frank and bill. Pours a deep bright hazy orange with tons of white lacing. Aroma is fresh citrus burst and Funk. Mouthfeel is refreshing and super refreshing with notes of fresh citrus, light funk, dank herb and pine. In no way is this a lager. Amazing pale ale.
Growler with friends. Pale gold pour. Amazing nose. Taste is sweet, citrusy, and super tropical. Absolutely clean finish. Really great.

UPDATED: NOV 24, 2012 Growler from frank, with him and Allen. Pours a hazy murky orange juice pour. Aromas and taste of amazing nz hops, cheese, kiwi, garlic, marmelade any other funky grains. Little bit of coconut, pineapple, mango, and other dank citrus and cheese. Light sugar, fulll flavored. Absolutely insane

Bottle at Chriso tasting, London. Thanks to Chriso himself! Pours clear yellow with a strong, frothy white head - lovely! Very fresh and hoppy on the nose, lots of piss and lemon. Medium sweet flavor with pale and bready malts, grass, lime. Medium to full bodied with fine carbonation. Modest warmth to finish with sticky pine, light pee and melon. Very solid beer. I love what Jack is up to.
1 pint and 9 fl oz bottle. Pours cloudy yellow with ahuge, chalke white head. Aroma is grapefruity and light pine hops. Bitter, grapefruity and light pine. Crisp hops fruity and bitter dry finish.
Bottle.   Bright juicy grapefruit,  pine, resin,  with a touch of pear and lightly boozed cracked dough.  Dry.   Heavy bitterness.    Enjoyable.   Lotta potent grapefruit.  Nice.

Tap.  Awesome hops!  The flavor is nice, fresh and strong with citrus up front and floral accents.  The bitterness is apparent mid taste but doesnt leave a lingering astringency in your mouth.  Cloudy yellow pour with medium head.  Excellent all around.

Aroma of dank, resiny hops, grapefruit, some light malts and bread.  Hazy golden pour, white head with good retention and lots of lacing.  Flavor is sticky hops, citrus, some onion, bread and toasty malt.  Fairly high bitterness, lingering for a while.  Medium body and carbonation.  Nice.
22oz bottle. Poured a lighter and hazy yellow color with a small sized head. Aroma s of floral hopw with some spiciness. Tastes of citrus, pine, juicy and fruity.

Lightly hazy golden color with a small, white head that left light lacing on the glass.  Aroma of pine, floral hops, resiny hops, citrus, and crisp, toffee malts.  Taste of much of the same, this was quite piney, in a pine sol type way, with a bit of alcohol in the finish.

Bottle shared by Sean, thanks! Pours a hazy yellowish gold with a white head that dissipates to the edges quickly. Aroma has real nice floral and pine hop with some backing sweet grains. Flavor has a good amount of pine and grapefruit hops with a bit of flora and backing sweet grains.

Snifter at Publick house Brookline. Good aroma. Sweet, spice, citrus,  runs the gambit. Grapefruit, lemon, lime, so I guess I see kiwi. Little sourdough. Toasted malt. Tad hazed, golden orange. Ok head  and minor lace. Bittersweet flavor. Medium body, smooth mouthfeel, bitter finish.  Nice, has interesting mix of flavors. Aroma best part. But tasty all together
user_location: the Containment Area, North Carolina, USA

text:
Bomber courtesy of AutumnBeerLove. Thanks again man. 

Pours a hazy, pale golden orange color with a 1.5 finger frothy white head that slowly fades into a lasting ring. Streaks and spots of soapy lacing left behind. 

Slightly earthy aroma with a prominent piney and citrus hop presence along with hints of grass and pale malt. Hints of pine needle, pineapple and citrus ring followed by some light fruit, straw and biscuit. 

Fuller bodied than expected with a very prominent dry hoppy presence up front that lingers over the sweeter notes into a lingering dry finish. Decently bitter with some pine needle flavor but this is countered by some sweet citrus and light fruit notes. slight earthy grass and straw presence add to the earthiness but again are balanced out by hints of apple and pear. Still, hop bitterness dominates the flavor throughout before finishing with some slight heat. 

Overall this beer is really flavorful but it could use a touch more sweetness for balance. There is some subtle heat in the finish but I was shocked to see that the ABV is so high. Fuller bodied than expected for the style but still pretty quaffable. I would love to try this again in the summer.

A light hazy lager. good carbonation. Aroma is super intense - spruce - big time. Flavor is super hoppy - lots of evergreen spice. Surprisingly drinkable with a long lingering bitter finish. Begs for another sip. Very good overall.

A curious looking bottle found its way home with me yesterday. Pours a cloudy deep straw color bordering on golden with a decent white head that displays minimal retention and lace. Smell comes through with lots of citrus with grapefruit and lemon dominating. Moderate pilsner malt deep underneath. Taste is quite hoppy, lots of citrus with barely any malt to back it up. Medium body with a moderate level of carbonation and a resinous mouthfeel.  Great hoppy brew and a great price too, I may have to revisit this again.

Pours golden orange with a light white head, no retention the aroma is like a Belgian IPA with kiwi hops coming through nicely. The flavor is bitter but smooth hops with light sweet notes at first before the bitterness sets in. Not like a lager at all.

Poured into a tulip. This brew is is hazy with a honey/wood-like color. Its white head is 1-finger in size and fades to a cap. 

Nice citrusy aroma; primarily grapefruit. Some bready malt is found in there.

The flavor provides a quick hit of orange sweetness up front before grapefruit quickly returns. Some honey is found in the middle providing a faintly sweet malt backbone. Bittersweet grapefruit returns in the end and leaves tart citrus notes lingering on the back of your tongue. 

Mouthfeel is on the thin side. In fact this is when Im reminded that this is still a lager...not for any technical reason, though. It looks like it would carry more weight on the tongue than it does. I have no problem with this, however.

In the end I really enjoyed this. Its clean, direct, flavorful, and I enjoyed it more near the end. My only complaint with this beer is that it doesnt taste all that much bigger or bolder than Hoponius Union. Im not sure if that speaks to Hoponius Unions greatness or a possible downfall in Kiwi Rising. Im thinking the former, as its hard to say anything bad about K.R.

Pours hazy deep gold into a Sam glass. Bright white head with little retention recedes leaving spot lacing. Mango and grapefruit aromas. Sweet tropical fruit upfront turning to thick grapefruit in the dry lasting finish.

22oz Bottle, purchased at Craft Beer Cellar - Belmont, MA. Cream, dense floral aroma. The hop levels are intense enough to approach complete saturation. The aroma reminds me of hops soaked in vodka. With this new style, DIPL, Im suprised to see something emerge thats completely unique, yet so much like similar beers. This has the big strong lager crispness and smoothness, and even some of the same hop expression, but with a dank, dank, dank citrus hop flavor of DIPAs. A nice marriage. Malt textures are super creamy and smooth, which I enjoy so much in the high gravity hop bombs, it works so well with the intense hop crush. This is great, but Im not sure the hop flavors are really double the Hoponious Union IPL and some drinkability is lost. That said, a really fun strong and hoppy lager that is expertly brewed.
